Every Halloween theme parks come alive with actors who are paid to startle attendees and in recent years elaborate haunted houses have gotten more popular each fall but these seasonal events are merely child's play compared to what is happening in the underground world of immersive horror
Here's this weekend's gym just go
Oh Tobar is Halloween season which means there are plenty of fun spooky adventures to check out at you and that sort of thing and some of those hearts really take things to a new level you only need to talk about some of these extreme hearts
Of those hearts really take things to a new level joining me to talk about some of these extreme haunts she's written a great piece about them for the New York times is Nicole pager a nickel
Hi how are you doing great in reading your article I was surprised to learn that some haunted house was another scary experiences are not just Halloween events are actually opened a thrill seekers year round
That's true and that's what's so crazy about this world is you know obviously we have these things like universal studios horror nights every year but there's this group of people that for that and that's just not enough and they're just looking for the three hundred and sixty five days a year
You mentioned heretic de Los Angeles as one of the leaders in extreme haunts what goes on in heretic
Man it's pretty crazy I'll say that first of all I'll have to admit I'm not a huge horror fan but I spent six hours at
A hair to ... so I feel like I really really went in it and it was almost a rite of passage for me to watch people go through that but everyone's experience was completely different that something that was really interesting to scare actors
Basically kind of size somebody up as they come in and they can read to see if they're going to be more afraid you know they grab them from the front or grab them from behind I mean
One woman had a plastic bag put over her head she was the rash around in the air they threw a cardboard box on top of her raped across it with a rake and then that guy punch through the box grabbed her neck I mean everyone's experience was different but
I have heard of people being stimulated buried alive waterboarded forced to eat some pretty crazy things they've had to light other actors on fire there's just some very interesting things that happen here and it seems like each one that happens it's just next level next level
You wrote about one guy who was visiting extreme haunts forty four times go one recently the event included with him stripped his boxers and curled into fetal position taken mud straw unseemly to body fluids his first words afterward that was awesome
[laughter] exactly so that was the one that I was that and you know it was interesting because that took place out in the middle of the desert and they said it was kind of an existential space crisis so people arrived they were blindfolded they were led to this dusty RV
They were stripped of their clothes and put in this stress base here and they were told that they were these criminals that had been on the bottom eyes and that they would be walking around the property collecting
Blood samples and trying to identify a couple of bodies that were there and they were given a walkie talkie there was this this embodied voice that was super creepy that was walking him through all of them is that they were supposed to make
And they walked through this property and there's fog and smoke everywhere they walk in there's a man let on fire running around screaming all these different actors encounter them and torture them and scare them in their own unique ways and
They ended up in this tent in the back in the pitch black with all this fog
And this man is monster with a mask just pops out of nowhere and starts rationing them around and
Rich the spacesuit are stripped him down to their underwear and is just nearing simulated bodily fluids goo and vomiting on their chest than yeah so the majority of these participants that ended up in the fetal position in their underwear and
What was the ... about it as that you know I'm watching this thinking wow that they must be really shaken up and they are but as they make the walk back off that property and kind of transition back into normal life they're so excited they would give it again they're telling me that these memories are going to last a lifetime
For the actors I guess there are some ... of these extreme haunts
Yeah they're not allowed to actually hurt the people one of the guys was kind of funny and he told me that his only rules are basically don't kill then don't permanently scarred them but you know
They actually get physical which is funny I mean you go to places like universal studios Hans and you know they pop out and I think a lot of them having no touching rural
And these guys can pick them up they can throw them around they can put their hands around their neck but they're not allowed to actually physically hurt them and some of the participants they leave with bruises they leave with circus scratches but they all said that they kind of expected that going in and
You know they all wanted to make it known that they're not into just being tortured for the sake of being torture but the beauty is that they're basically living their own horror films and as long as it moves the story forward there are all about it
